explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 515degC (ICSC, 2004)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 593mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,300mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000)), 302mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), 390mg/kg (SIDS (2002)), 320mg/kg, 1,005mg/kg, 1,295mg/kg, 1,050mg/kg, 1,090mg/kg, 1,182mg/kg, 1,081mg/kg, 731mg/kg, 323mg/kg, 298mg/kg, 310mg/kg, 743mg/kg and 627mg/kg (EHC 157 (1994)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 74,800mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000) and EHC 157 (1994)): "Application of 10% aqueous solution produced irritation of the skin" (though results are not those of 4-hour application). Also based on the description in the report on epidemiological studies of human exposure (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000), EHC 157 (1994) and DFGOT vol.10 (1998)): "irritating to the skin." The substance is thus considered to possess an irritation potential (of an unknown degree) and can be classified into Category 2 or 3. Placed in Category 2 from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on eye irritation tests in guinea pigs and rabbits (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000), EHC 157 (1994), DFGOT vol.10 (1998) and SIDS (2002)): "Mild to moderate irritation was observed." Although classified into Category 2A-2B, the substance should be placed in Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: A number of "positive" results have been reported from guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000) and EHC 157 (1994)). Also human epidemiological studies provide evidence of skin sensitization (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000), EHC 157 (1994) and DFGOT vol.10 (1998)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and positive data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, described in EHC 157 (1994), SIDS (2002), CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000) and NTP DB (Access on March 2006).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of an increased incidence of resorptions with no maternal toxicity, described in EHC 157 (1994).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "major toxic effects of hydroquinone include tremor, vomiting, abdominal pain, headache, tachycardia, hyporeflexia, dark urine, dyspnea, cyanosis and coma" (EHC 157 (1994)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies: "enzymuria, glucosuria, increased epitheliocytes in the urine were observed" (EHC 157 (1994)), "nerve/muscle shrinkage and tremor were found" (IUCLID (2000)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory organs, blood system) Category 2 (central nervous system, liver, kidneys)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "significant decrease in pulmonary function in the exposed group" (EHC 157 (1994)), and the evidence from animal studies including "tremor and decreased activity," "hepatic lesions including syncytial cells and giant cells observed" (EHC 157 (1994)), "tremor and spasm," "decreased hematocrit levels/hemoglobin levels/RBC, dose-dependent increase in kidney damage" (NTP TR 366 (1989)), "hematological changes such as anisocytosis, polychromatophilia and acidophil erythroblast were detected" (CERI Hazard Data 99-19 (2000)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=44microg/L of the fish (Fathead Minnows) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 70% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.59 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
